intro: Quararibea stenopetala, commonly known as the narrow-petaled quina, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It is valued for its medicinal properties, with the bark and leaves used in traditional medicine to treat various ailments. Due to habitat loss, it is also considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
